intro: Silene kotschyi var. maritima, commonly known as the sea campion, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and hairy, succulent leaves adapted to saline and arid environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along shores and dunes. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Silene kotschyi var. maritima is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing coastal habitats.
